channel.title: KISS Linux News
channel.description: An independent Linux® distribution with a focus on simplicity and the concept of "less is more". The distribution currently targets the x86-64 architecture and the English language.

item.title: 11/08/2020: Changes to repositories using symlinks to /var/db/kiss/repo
item.description: In two weeks' time, the assumption that the official repositories live in /var/db/kiss/repo will be removed. This change only affects repositories which contain symlinks to this location.

item.title: 11/05/2020: Encryption support moved outside init
item.description: Encryption support in the init scripts will be moved to an external project. Development will happen at a quicker pace and be done by members of the community (those who use encryption themselves).

item.title: 09/05/2020: GCC 10.1.0 kernel issue
item.description: The kernel compiled with GCC 10.1.0 may crash on boot.

item.title: 14/01/2020: Firefox binaries now available
item.description: Binaries for Firefox are now available in the official repositories under the package name firefox-bin.

item.title: 01/01/2020: Firefox privacy changes moved to firefox-privacy
item.description: The vendor.js and policies.json files KISS uses to harden and prevent Firefox from phoning home are now opt-in and optional.
